sentences.en: A good and qualified diplomat should not be consid - ered a loose cannon.
sentences.cn: 一位够水平的外交官,不会毫不克制的直言不讳.

sentences.en: A role as senior diplomat would be a good alibi for his absence.
sentences.cn: 高级外交官的角色将是他缺席的上佳托词。

sentences.en: As a diplomat, you have to pick your words at a press conference.
sentences.cn: 作为一位外交官, 在记者招待会上必须措词谨慎.

sentences.en: But others perceived him as an intelligent, poised and polite diplomat.
sentences.cn: 但另外还有一些人把他看成是聪明, 稳重而彬彬有礼的外交官.

sentences.en: He a diplomat of great eclat.
sentences.cn: 他是个声望显赫的外交家。

sentences.en: He started his official career as a diplomat.
sentences.cn: 他从当外交官起开始了他的从政生涯.

sentences.en: He was a diplomat skilled at communicating with foreigners.
sentences.cn: 他善于与外国人打交道.

sentences.en: His job as a diplomat was a blind for his spying.
sentences.cn: 他担任外交官的职务是为了给他的间谍身分打掩护.

sentences.en: His job as a diplomat was just a screen for his life as a spy.
sentences.cn: 他做外交官的工作只不过是间谍生涯的一种掩护.

sentences.en: That diplomat is reputed for his ability to speak four languages.
sentences.cn: 那位外交官以能讲四种语言而闻名.

sentences.en: The diplomat celebrated his appointment to the new consulate.
sentences.cn: 这名外交官庆祝自己被派到了新领事馆.
那位女士是个善于交际的人.

sentences.en: The two countries have each expelled another diplomat following a round of tit-for-tat expulsions.
sentences.cn: 在一轮针锋相对的驱逐事件之后，两国各又驱逐了一名外交官。

sentences.en: This diplomat possessed an excellent gift for repartee.
sentences.cn: 这位外交官具有卓越的应对才能.

words.tran_cn: 外交的；外交上的；老练的
在外交上；靠外交途径；圆滑地；婉转地
外交；外交手腕；交际手段

trans.tran_en: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country
